intro: Mesembryanthemum relaxatum, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent characteristics and ability to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often appearing in clusters. Its leaves are typically fleshy and covered in a fine layer of white powder, which helps reduce water loss. Mesembryanthemum relaxatum is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
